result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin R. Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription - as approved by agent..  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay fine of $7099.00   and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber allowed.  Credit for 64 days served.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Chavez.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions; 12 months of conditional jail w/Huber privileges effective this date; credit for 64 days served; $7,099.00 total fine/costs (including IID surcharge and $250 DNA surcharge); bond applied to fine/costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster; 3 year suspension of DL; IID; OWI assessment.
WCS report;  Defendant has successfully completed Chapter 85.53 requirements.
